text: Kirk and Jessica's 2024
2024 was nonstop for us as we balanced work and life, survived a hurricane, and moved into our fifth year of marriage.
Kirk

Kirk continued work as a newsroom developer at the Boston Globe and was lucky enough to win some national journalism awards for his interactive storytelling work. He's still involved with Asian American Journalists Association and has taken several young journalists under his wing to teach them about the world of journalism, data reporting, and software development. He went to his first AAJA conference in Austin this year too!

At church, Kirk continued volunteering on Houston Chinese Church's worship team and stepped down from leadership with his small group, although he and Jessica are still members. He started a men's book club that's now almost done with their book so he will need recommendations for the next book to read. Kirk's currently working on producing songs with folks at HCC that he hopes will be out soon for the church to hear. He'll also be returning to CMC Youth 2024 to play on the worship team this December.
On the side, he's running more often and plays Smash Bros. Ultimate with any challengers he can find (maining Incineroar and Dr. Mario).
Jessica

Jessica is in her fourth and final year of residency at Baylor College of Medicine, where she also serves as the chief resident of the Med-Peds program. She loves her job taking care of adults and children in various hospitals and clinics in the Houston area and spending time with her co-residents. Jessica's work took us to the Navajo Nation for a month as she worked in an IHS (Indian Health Service) hospital in Shiprock. She'll graduate in June of 2025, and we're excited to see where God calls her next.

Jessica has loved pouring into our CG by cooking and hosting our quickly growing group. Her research into gardening in Houston has paid off—she had a bumper crop of tomatoes, lettuce and herbs this year. In 2024, we cooked and ate many new recipes including hot pot mille-feuille, Japanese KFC chicken rice, and pasta alla zozzona. We've loved exploring the food scene in Houston together and with friends. Many of her oldest and closest friends came to visit her in Houston, and they got to spend lots of quality time together!
Trips
In 2024, we flew many times for many things. We flew on many airlines and will thus never accrue enough loyalty points for one airline for anything meaningful.
Raleigh: Went to Kirk's cousin Deirdre's wedding and stopped by the Natural Science museum
Dallas: To see a Cory Wong concert! One of the best concerts that we've been to.
Philly: Back home for Laolao's 95th birthday
Cancun: A three-day vacation, and Kirk's first resort experience. Virgin Miami Vices all around!
Mexico City: Because flights are cheaper from Houston than on the East Coast! We bounced from one taco shop to another with breaks for churros in between.
Hawaii: We took a little An family vacation out to O'ahu where we had some form of spam every single day—and we wouldn't have had it any other way.

Fairfax, VA: Laura's baby shower (and a couple weddings) brought us back to the East Coast, where we met up as a family for the first time since Hawaii, and celebrated the imminent arrival of Arie Cheng!
Shiprock: We loved living on the reservation and learned how to make Navajo fry bread. Here's the Shiprock, the namesake of the town we lived in.
Mesa Verde: On one of our afternoons in Shiprock, NM, we drove up to Colorado to see the cliff dwellings and to catch the sunset in Mesa Verde National Park.
Arches National Park: We traveled to Moab, Utah (highly recommend!) and hiked Arches and Canyonlands.

Grand Canyon: On our second weekend, we went to Grand Canyon National Park (Kirk's first visit) and spent our time hiking and not knowing what time it was because of daylight savings changing and being in Arizona.
Monument Valley/Forrest Gump highway: After Jessica's rotation, we set off on a week-long adventure which started in Monument Valley.
Antelope Canyon: Our tour guide knew all the best places to take photos!
Zion: Our favorite hike here was the Watchman Trail! It was the perfect time of day when we went.
Bryce Canyon: Hoodoos everywhere! It was snowing and 18 degrees—definitely a change for us Houstonians.
Houston: Jessica's family visited Houston to celebrate Thanksgiving with us for the fourth year in a row! We cooked a delicious Thanksgiving meal and explored the city's food scene together.
